class homura.callbacks.MetricCallback(metric: Callable[[collections.abc.Mapping], Any], name: str, logger=None, no_reduce: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: homura.callbacks.Callback

Base class of MetricCallback class such as AccuracyCallback

  • metric – metric function: (data) -> float
  • name – name of the metric
  • logger –
  • no_reduce – skip reducing
after_epoch(data: collections.abc.Mapping)[source]¶

before_epoch(data: collections.abc.Mapping)[source]¶
before_iteration(data: collections.abc.Mapping)[source]¶
history¶

History of metric.

Returns:dict of histories in {mode: [history]}

Using this property, history of metrics can be used after a training loop

>>> metric = ...
>>> # training loop
>>> final_result = metric.history["val"][-1]
reduce(tensor)[source]¶

for distributed setting

homura.callbacks.metric_callback_decorator(_metric: Callable = None, name: str = None)[source]¶

Decorator to create a metrics callback

>>> @metric_callback_decorator("loss")
>>> def loss(data):
>>>     return data["loss"]

homura.reporters module¶

class homura.reporters.LoggerReporter(callbacks: Union[Iterable[homura.callbacks.Callback], homura.callbacks.Callback], save_dir: Optional[str] = None, logger: Optional[logging.Logger] = None, report_freq: int = -1, save_image_freq: int = 0, image_keys: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None, save_log: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: homura.reporters.Reporter

Something like this

with LoggerReporter(...) as lr:
    trainer = ...
    for _ in range(100):
        ...

Reports like this

[homura.reporter|2019-02-30 27:31:20|INFO] [      1]                      loss_test 0.4413
[homura.reporter|2019-02-30 27:31:20|INFO] [      1]                  accuracy_test 0.8631
Parameters:
  • callbacks –
  • save_dir –
  • report_freq –
  • save_image_freq – If n>0, saves images every n iteration. if n==-1, every epoch. This may need large storage space.
  • image_keys – keys for images.
class homura.reporters.Reporter(base_wrapper: homura.utils.reporter_backends._WrapperBase, callbacks: Union[Iterable[homura.callbacks.Callback], homura.callbacks.Callback], report_freq: int = -1, report_param_freq: int = 0, report_image_freq: int = 0, image_keys: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: homura.callbacks.Callback

class homura.reporters.TQDMReporter(iterator: Iterable[T_co], callbacks: Union[Iterable[homura.callbacks.Callback], homura.callbacks.Callback], save_dir: Optional[str] = None, report_freq: int = -1, save_image_freq: int = 0, image_keys: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None)[source]¶

Bases: homura.reporters.Reporter

Reporter using tqdm. Use like

with TQDMReporter(range(100), callbacks) as tq:
    trainer = ...
    for _ in tq:
        ...

The output is like

100%|█| 200/200 [1:01:10<00:00, 18.44s/it, loss_test=0.358, accuracy_test=0.919]
Parameters:
  • iterator –
  • callbacks –
  • save_dir –
  • report_freq –
  • save_image_freq – If n>0, saves images every n iteration. if n==-1, every epoch. This may need large storage space.
  • image_keys – keys for images.
class homura.reporters.TensorboardReporter(callbacks: Union[Iterable[homura.callbacks.Callback], homura.callbacks.Callback], save_dir=None, report_freq: int = -1, report_params_freq: int = 0, report_images_freq: int = 0, image_keys: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None, save_images: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: homura.reporters.Reporter

Reporter using Tensorboard.

with TensorboardReporter(...) as tb:
    trainer = ...
    for _ in range(100):
        ...
Parameters:
  • callbacks –
  • save_dir –
  • report_freq –
  • report_params_freq – If n>0, reports parameter histograms every n iteration. if n==-1, every epoch.
  • report_images_freq – If n>0, reports images every n iteration. if n==-1, every epoch.
  • image_keys – keys for images.
  • save_images – If True, saving images in addition to reporting
class homura.reporters.VisdomReporter(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Deprecated. Use TensorboardReporter instead.

homura.trainers module¶

class homura.trainers.TrainerBase(model: torch.nn.modules.module.Module, optimizer: Optional[homura.optim.Optimizer], loss_f: Optional[Callable], *, callbacks: Optional[homura.callbacks.Callback] = None, scheduler: Optional[homura.lr_scheduler.LRScheduler] = None, update_scheduler_by_epoch: bool = True, device: Optional[torch.device] = None, verb=True, use_cudnn_benchmark=True, use_cuda_nonblocking=False, logger=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: homura.utils.runner.Runner

Parameters:
  • model – nn.Module or dict like {“generator”: gen, “discriminator”: dis}
  • optimizer – homura.optimizer.Optimizer or dict like {“generator”: Adam(lr=3e-4)}
  • loss_f – loss function or dict of loss functions
  • callbacks – callbacks or list of callbacks
  • scheduler – homura.scheduler.LRScheduler or dict like {“generator”: StepLR(10)}
  • update_scheduler_by_epoch – If True, update scheduler every epoch. If False and scheduler is given, scheduler is need to be update by user.
  • device –
  • verb –
  • use_cudnn_benchmark –
  • use_cuda_nonblocking –
  • logger –
  • kwargs –
epoch¶
is_train¶
iteration(data: Iterable[torch.Tensor]) → Mapping[str, torch.Tensor][source]¶

Iteration part, user can override via duck typing or override_iteration

def iteration(self, data: Tuple[torch.Tensor]) -> Mapping[str, torch.Tensor]:
    input, target = data
    output = self.model(input)
    loss = self.loss_f(output, target)
    if self.is_train:
        self.optimizer.zero_grad()
        loss.backward()
        self.optimizer.step()
    return Map(loss=loss, output=output)
Parameters:data – data used during a iteration
Returns:loss, output
override_iteration(new_iteration: Callable)[source]¶

Override iteration method

def new_iteration(trainer, data):
    input, target = data
    ...
    results.loss = loss
    return results
trainer.update_iteration(new_iteration)
Parameters:new_iteration –

iteration(data: Tuple[torch.Tensor]) → Mapping[str, torch.Tensor][source]¶

Iteration part, user can override via duck typing or override_iteration

def iteration(self, data: Tuple[torch.Tensor]) -> Mapping[str, torch.Tensor]:
    input, target = data
    output = self.model(input)
    loss = self.loss_f(output, target)
    if self.is_train:
        self.optimizer.zero_grad()
        loss.backward()
        self.optimizer.step()
    return Map(loss=loss, output=output)
Parameters:data – data used during a iteration
Returns:loss, output

iteration(data: Tuple[torch.Tensor]) → Mapping[str, torch.Tensor][source]¶

Iteration part, user can override via duck typing or override_iteration

def iteration(self, data: Tuple[torch.Tensor]) -> Mapping[str, torch.Tensor]:
    input, target = data
    output = self.model(input)
    loss = self.loss_f(output, target)
    if self.is_train:
        self.optimizer.zero_grad()
        loss.backward()
        self.optimizer.step()
    return Map(loss=loss, output=output)
Parameters:data – data used during a iteration
Returns:loss, output

Module contents¶

class homura.Map(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: collections.abc.MutableMapping, dict

dict like object but: stored values can be subscribed and attributed.

>>> m = Map(test="test")
>>> m.test is m["test"]
